post.summary: Authenticate user and handle 2FA if enabled
post.description: Authenticates a user with email and password. Supports both session-based and token-based authentication. If two-factor authentication is enabled, sends a 2FA code via email.

parameters.name: X-Request-Token
parameters.description: Header to indicate token-based authentication request

message.example: Two-factor authentication code has been sent to your email.

warning.example: Two-factor authentication is enabled but the code could not be sent. You have been logged in without 2FA verification.

204.description: Login successful for session-based authentication (no JSON response)

message.example: These credentials do not match our records.

items.example: These credentials do not match our records.

422.description: Validation error or rate limit exceeded

items.example: Too many login attempts. Please try again in 60 seconds.

post.summary: Logout user and destroy session or revoke token
post.description: Logs out the authenticated user. For token-based authentication, revokes the current access token. For session-based authentication, destroys the session.

post.summary: Send a new email verification notification
post.description: Sends a new email verification link to the authenticated user. Handles both token-based and session-based requests.

parameters.name: X-Request-Token
parameters.description: Header to indicate token-based authentication request

200.description: Verification link sent or already verified

302.description: Redirect to dashboard if already verified (session-based)

message.example: Too many requests. Please try again later.

post.description: Resets the user's password using a valid token.

items.example: This password reset token is invalid.

post.description: Sends a password reset link to the user's email address.

status.example: We have emailed your password reset link!

422.description: Validation error or unable to send reset link

items.example: We can't find a user with that email address.

post.description: Registers a new user and returns user data and token for token-based requests, or no content for session-based requests.

parameters.name: X-Request-Token
